meanings.definition: A person who believes that trivial matters are of great importance.
meanings.sent1: The trivialist in our group always insists on discussing the smallest details.
meanings.sent2: She is known as a trivialist because she thinks small matters are crucial.
meanings.sent3: The trivialist made a big fuss over the color of the paper clips.
meanings.sent4: Being a trivialist is like magnifying a speck of dust into a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The trivialist's obsession with minor issues is truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: One who focuses on trivial or unimportant details.
meanings.sent1: As a trivialist, he spent hours debating the font size on the presentation slides.
meanings.sent2: The trivialist couldn't help but nitpick every insignificant aspect of the project.
meanings.sent3: The trivialist's attention to unimportant details sometimes leads to comic situations.
meanings.sent4: In a world of big ideas, the trivialist is lost in a sea of minutiae.
meanings.sent5: Her reputation as a trivialist grew as she continued to fixate on trivial matters.
